string.value: What a strange thing... It's like a mark. No wonder people are afraid: I'm feeling uneasy here myself. I'd better go and report this phenomenon to Midgard.
BANDIT|Well-well, who's coming to see us?
CARAVANNER MADS|You saved me, stranger!!
I was sent by a merchant from Rimskoe. Thank him for your salvation.
CARAVANNER MADS|Thank him? For the fact that he, knowing about these bandits, still sent me on a trip? No way!
Well, it's up to you to decide.
CARAVANNER MADS|What were you promised for my survival?
Information. I'm looking for an explorer who lives in the middle of nowhere.
CARAVANNER MADS|Ben, is it? In that case, Stryga fooled you. Anyone who lives around these area knows about his place!
And so do you?
CARAVANNER MADS|Sure. Go down the hill where Midgard stands, and you'll see a little hut. That's Ben's place. There's only one house there, so you can't miss it.
Well, thank you for your help.
CARAVANNER MADS|You're welcome. It's the least I can do for saving my life.
I assume they stole all of your merchandise?
CARAVANNER MADS|All of it. But that's not your problem anymore. Not even mine. I think this is my last trip for this trader.
Where do you plan to go next?
CARAVANNER MADS|I'm going to try my luck in Eastern. They say there will soon be regular caravans from there to Sowth. It would be foolish to miss such an opportunity.
Yeah, it's been hard to find any traveling traders in Sowth lately. I'm from that region myself, so I know what I'm talking about.
CARAVANNER MADS|If I ever get into Sowth, I'll be sure to tell them how you saved my life.
Stop by Dronn's bar, he'll help you.
CARAVANNER MADS|I will. All right, I'll take it from here.
Goodbye. Thank you for your help.
ORATOR|The battle begins!
ORATOR|Let the battle begin!
Do you wish to travel to another region?
I don't know where this road leads, so I'll stay here.
Now, they won't let me within a mile of this town. What am I supposed to do?
Maybe that village down the road could help me?
What?! How did I get here?! The last thing I remember is that I was drinking tea at Grandma's house...
Ah, hell with it! I don't even want to know what happened. Wait. What the heck is that?!
The invaders have been killed. I think I should take a couple of boxes as a proof. Those should work.
Get in the back of my truck! Quickly! And don't do anything stupid! Someone really wants to talk to you.
||@FF000000AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA...AAAAAAA@FFFFFFFFThe next day
Ah, to hell! I don't even want to know what happened. I need to get to Midgard as soon as possible and find out about Ben there.
||@FF000000AAAAAAAAAA.AAAAAAAAAAAAA@FFFFFFFFOne hour later
What have I done...
Trying to find someone I had never seen in my life, I ignored the people who were my life.
Lisa... Even though I wanted to kill you when you stole my father's disks, I always knew you are a good person. Even then, in Sowth, when my common sense told me to refuse, I agreed to help you.
Because I saw something in you that I didn't see in other people. An idea. A purpose. You were so passionate about it that I felt obligated to help you. I wish I'd known where this was going...

Ben... You've always helped me, even though you didn't have to. You found old documents and told me where to look for the Oracle. You told me where to find Lisa, even though you didn't know what I would do when I found her.
You trusted me. And you tried to talk us out of going to the desert until the last minute. You had a feeling about how it would end, and we didn't listen to you.
It's all me. I'm the one who can't stop on time. I am responsible for your deaths! Me and no one else! It's all my fault...
As a result, not only was I unable to see my father, but I also lost the only two people who needed me. And worst of all, the people I needed.
I won't make another mistake from now on! That's it! I'm finally going to make the only right decision!
Password for the bonus ending: **w************|For more information, read the mod's manual on GitHub.
I couldn't protect the caravan. They would not be happy about it in Midgard, that's for sure.

The destruction of the Njeri outpost, the aliens from other worlds, unleashed the Oracle. The first thing he did was to take control of the orbital weaponry and launch a nuclear attack on Zarmek. When the source of the contamination was destroyed, many experienced a shock from which not all could recover.

The mysterious radiation was too deeply rooted in human nature. In an attempt to rectify the evil caused, the supercomputer slowly began to extend itself into all areas of human life. From its blueprints, numerous useful devices were rebuilt.

All sorts of robotic assistants were assigned to each survivor to help them with everything. The people, however, did not accept the change. Many gave up the Oracle's gifts and returned to simple activities. And increasingly, some regretted the disappearance of the voice that incessantly whispered of ascension.

Although the Oracle's mobile module was destroyed, the computer itself remained unharmed. His metal servants have returned to the jungle and make occasional raids on Njeri's expeditions. The successful installation of the blocker has caused a noticeable change in people's lives.

The alien base moved to Zarmek, where they were finally able to safely explore the emissions and their effects on humans. The first experiments were quite successful: some people managed to take off their masks and survive. Though, only within the walls of Njeri's laboratory.

For the first time in many years, people had hope for the restoration of the old world. But the most farsighted people began to realize that the fall of the alien ship was not accidental, and that the plans of the new allies might differ greatly from people's expectations.

The Vaterland fell into degradation. Having captured Pesht, the Brigade cut off the most important trade route, cutting off 70% of Minin's profits. The surrounding villages are half extinct, Minin himself is in poverty, and only the leaders of the Brigade are both rich and powerful.

Despite the Brigade's recent successes in the war with the traders, the latter managed to recapture Pesht and everything is back to normal. The Brigade is still destroying about 30% of the trade caravans, and the regional capital, Minin, is still in poverty.

For the first time in many years, peace has prevailed in Vaterland. The Brigade clan, who constantly terrorized the northern traders, has been completely destroyed, and the weapons found at their base are now used to protect their caravans.

The new mayor of Minin not only established oil supplies to all the surrounding villages, but also turned the city into the largest trading zone, where every free trader can profitably sell his goods.

Calm has returned to the Druid Grove. With the rescue of the rebels from Uluk, the Druids were able to prevent the assassination of the Main Druid and completely suppress the rebellion of the Children of Iron. Now all the towns in the Grove live in harmony and the steel monsters no longer trouble anyone.
The distant islands of the Druid Grove are currently in chaos. Although the Druids succeeded in preventing an assassination attempt on the High Druid, a bloody civil war has spread to the region.
More and more young people embrace the religion of the Children of Iron and take up arms against their brothers. And there is no way to tell for sure how this confrontation will end.

Dark times have come for the Druid Grove. After the murder of the High Druid, the Children of Iron took over the region and forced the Druids to deny their faith. Those who refused were publicly executed.

Fearing further events, the Oracle decided to act preventively and burned out the entire region with a powerful air strike. Now, instead of the flowering Grove, the island is nothing but scorched earth.

After the victory of the anti-militarist movement, the CIT and CD stopped their existence. Now Argen and Librium are united under the Union of Liberated Countries - a faction created by anti-militarist leaders after the victory in the war.
It is too early to tell, but it is all but certain that the Union of Liberated Countries will be the first faction to make such significant progress in governing the country.

Having crushed the CD, the CIT began to fight its internal enemies. The anti-militarist movement was completely destroyed and its leaders were executed. Although peace returned to the region, many were dissatisfied with this aggressive policy, and no one knows exactly where the growing discontent in the country will lead in the future.

Having crushed the CIT, the CD established the dictatorship of the Church of Enlightment in both countries. The anti-militarist movement was completely destroyed and its leaders were executed. Civilians were also executed en masse if they refused to accept the new religion.
The population is demoralized and depressed, the region is in crisis, and no one is even trying to change this.

As for the main character, he was left with mixed feelings. He did not succeed in what he had planned, and this thought keeps on bothering him. He did not find the strength to give up the life of a mercenary, and he did not want to do so as well, so he continued to live the road and pick up every assignment, so as not to sit idle.

Lisa also continued to travel the world in search of another goal, but so far she hasn't been able to find anything worthwhile. Who knows, maybe one day she and the main character will meet again, and God only knows how it will turn out.

Despite the closing of the borders and a considerable military force, the northern merchants eventually lost the war with the fishermen and returned back to the Vaterland. Peace and tranquility now returned to Hel.

Despite their best efforts, the fishermen could not stop the occupation of their lands, and now the NPT completely control the region. All survived locals were gathered into the last village and surrounded by a high wall, creating a kind of reservation. Now nothing stands in the way of free trade anymore.

With outside help, the people of Lidencloud managed to fight off the Adepts and leave these troubled lands in time. They successfully made it to Le Canada and started a new life there, while the Adepts returned to their lands and never attacked anyone again.

After crushing the last remnants of resistance, the Adepts burned every village in Lidencloud and destroyed the bridge linking these lands to Sage Mountains. Now a new, powerful totalitarian state is developing in these lands, one that has yet to play its sinister role in the history of the New World.
Despite all the bandits' attempts to take over Sowth, it stood firm. The timely help of one brave and concerned traveler literally saved the entire Krai.

Sowth has failed to repel the bandits' attack, and now the city belongs to the Vagabonds clan, which came to replace Felix's team, which was destroyed after the disappearance of its leader. The population of the Krai is in fear, the bandits' fees are growing every day, and it seems that there is no more hope for a brighter future.
After such a powerful repulse, the bandits dropped all attempts to occupy the town and returned to robbery and looting, doing which is becoming more and more difficult every day.
||@FF000000AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA@FFFFFFFFThe next day
||@FF000000AAAAAAAAAAAI.AAAAAAAAAAAAAA@FFFFFFFFOne hour later
